content:
Here are some tips to improve the post and attract more candidates/engagement:

1. Add a catchy headline: Start the post with a headline that captures the attention of potential candidates. For example, "Join one of the biggest names in British Media and Publishing as a Technical Business Analyst!"
2. Emphasize the benefits: Instead of just listing the job requirements and responsibilities, focus on the benefits of the position. For example, highlight the company culture, opportunities for growth, or any unique perks of the job.
3. Use a more engaging tone: Use language that's more conversational and friendly, rather than formal and dry. This will help the post feel more approachable and make potential candidates more likely to engage with it.
4. Include a call to action: End the post with a clear call to action, encouraging potential candidates to get in touch or apply for the position. You could also include a link to the job posting or company website.

Here's an example of a revised post that incorporates these tips:

📣 Join one of the biggest names in British Media and Publishing as a Technical Business Analyst! 🚀

💥 2x Technical Business Analyst, Contract
💷 £575 per day Inside IR35
📍 London based, 1 day per week in the office

We're looking for two talented Technical Business Analysts to join our team and help us drive our brands forward. As a part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and collaborate closely with our Engineering team to make a real impact.

In this role, you'll have the chance to lead technical conversations that translate the strategic direction and product roadmap into feasible and defined feature requests. You'll also have the opportunity to grow your skills and make a meaningful impact on our brands.

If you're interested in this opportunity, please get in touch! We'd love to hear from you.
